class="pon" style="display:none">1</div> <button class="price buy id-track-click" data-server-cookie="CAIaJQojEiEKG2NvbS50cmFjaW5nZ2FtZXMud2hhbGVwaWFubxABGAM=" data-uitype="223">    <span class="display-price">免費</span>   </button>    </span>     </span> </div>  <div class="description">  Tap and hold these animated realistic 3D humpback whales and play music. You can strike a chord of up to five humpback whales. This is a cool animal piano for all animal and pet piano, animal and pet sounds lovers.<p>The whales move and sing real melodious whale songs. Each whale corresponds to a piano key with realistic pitch intervals. Be sure to hold a whale for at least several seconds to hear the whole song. After that the song will be played again from the beginning.</p><p>Thus, you can play as if you were playing the piano. But whales are much cooler. You should hear it! This is a piano for true whale lovers.</p><p>Interesting information on humpback whales from Wikipedia:</p><p>"The humpback whale (Megaptera novaeangliae) is a species of baleen whale. One of the larger rorqual species, adults range in length from 12–16 metres (39–52 ft) and weigh approximately 36,000 kilograms (79,000 lb). The humpback has a distinctive body shape, with unusually long pectoral fins and a knobbly head. An acrobatic animal known for breaching and slapping the water with its tail and pectorals, it is popular with whale watchers off Australia, New Zealand, South America, Canada, and the United States. Males produce a complex song lasting 10 to 20 minutes, which they repeat for hours at a time. Its purpose is not clear, though it may have a role in mating.</p><p>Found in oceans and seas around the world, humpback whales typically migrate up to 25,000 kilometres (16,000 mi) each year. Humpbacks feed only in summer, in polar waters, and migrate to tropical or subtropical waters to breed and give birth in the winter. During the winter, humpbacks fast and live off their fat reserves. Their diet consists mostly of krill and small fish. Humpbacks have a diverse repertoire of feeding methods, including the bubble net feeding technique.</p><p>Like other large whales, the humpback was and is a target for the whaling industry. Once hunted to the brink of extinction, its population fell by an estimated 90% before a moratorium was introduced in 1966. While stocks have since partially recovered, entanglement in fishing gear, collisions with ships, and noise pollution continue to impact the 80,000 humpbacks worldwide.</p><p>Both male and female humpback whales vocalize, but only males produce the long, loud, complex "songs" for which the species is famous. Each song consists of several sounds in a low register, varying in amplitude and frequency, and typically lasting from 10 to 20 minutes. Humpbacks may sing continuously for more than 24 hours. Cetaceans have no vocal cords, so whales generate their songs by forcing air through their massive nasal cavities."</p><p>(c) http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Humpback_whale</p><p></p><p></p><p></p><p></p><p></p><p></p><p></p> <span class="paragraph-end"></span> <a class="card-click-target" 钢琴的孩子，钢琴婴儿，钢琴幼儿，这架钢琴有钢琴和木琴的按键音，也有乐器声音的吉他，鼓，小号，小提琴和钟。而这些有趣的声音，可以切换到鼓，和动物的声音。所有这一切都与音乐主题走到一起：俏皮，困了圣诞节，所以乐趣可以持续更长的时间和适合你的孩子的幽默的时刻。 <span class="paragraph-end"></span> <a class="card-click-target" title="Learn Music Notes Free Trainer"> 492.    Learn Music Notes Free Trainer  <span class="paragraph-end"></span> </a> </h2>   <div class="subtitle-container">  <a class="subtitle" href="/store/apps/developer?id=New+Age+Pirates" title="New Age Pirates">New Age Pirates</a>   <span class="price-container"> <span class="paragraph-end"></span>   <span class="apps is-price-tag buy-button-container" data-doc-fetch-skip-cache="0" data-doc-fetch-vouchers="0" data-docid="com.NewAgePirates.NoteZart"> <div class="pon" style="display:none">1</div> <button class="price buy id-track-click" data-server-cookie="CAIaJAoiEiAKGmNvbS5OZXdBZ2VQaXJhdGVzLk5vdGVaYXJ0EAEYAw==" data-uitype="223">    <span class="display-price">免費</span>   </button>    </span>     </span> </div>  <div class="description">  NoteZart is a fun music notes game, music sight reading trainer. It helps you learn music notes easily, improve your sight reading and train your musical ear.<p>Clefs:<br>- Treble Clef<br>- Bass Clef</p><p>Modes:<br>- Learn Notes Mode<br>- Sight Reading Mode<br>- Hear Notes Mode</p><p>In the game's main screen you can select Treble or Bass clefs with different levels. </p><p>There are 68 levels in total. In each level, different pieces of music notes come along with the three music mode options; Learn Notes Mode, Sight Reading Mode and Hear Notes Mode. </p><p>The music notes flows on the screen with the relevant piano sounds. Learn Notes Mode and Sight Reading Mode will teach you music notes and train your music sight reading, while Hear Notes Mode improves your musical ear. </p><p>Players have to hit the correct music note on the piano keys below the staff ledger.  If it is the right music note, the music note turns into green. In the Learn Notes Mode, where player learns music notes, if player hits the wrong music note or doesn't hit any piano keys, the correct music note appears on the pop up screen. In the Sight Reading Mode, in which player improves music sight reading, the speed of the game increases in time; as a music note in 4 seconds, in 2 seconds and finally in 1 second! In the Hear Notes Mode, musical ear training for the player; the player just hears the piano sound of the music note, but not sees the music note on the screen.</p><p>After you complete the 68 levels, you will have learned all the music notes of Treble and Bass clefs, while you improve your sight reading and train musical ear! </p><p>Moreover you can go settings from the main menu and select one of the music notations below:<br>- Southern and Eastern Europeans (do re mi fa sol la si)<br>- English (C D E F G A B)<br>- North European (C D E F G A H)<br>- Bizantine (Ni Pa Vu Ga Di Ke Zo)<br>- Indian (Sa Re Ga Ma Pa Dha Ni).</p><p></p><p></p><p></p><p></p><p></p><p></p><p></p> <span class="paragraph-end"></span> <a class="card-click-target" First, hear the notes. <br>2. Try to tap on the guitar fret <br>   in the same order that you think they are.<br>3. If your answer is correct, you go to <br>   the next stage. <br>4. If your answer is wrong, tap to guess <br>   the notes again.<br>5. Your score is the sum of the time that <br>   you spent on 10 games.<br>6. Answer as quickly as possible <br>   and compete against other players. </p><p>■ game screen display<br>· Total score<br>Remaining game score when you clear will be added.</p><p>· Game count<br>Surface will proceed Clearing.</p><p>· Game Score<br>Time spent in the game will be displayed as a score.</p><p>■ game level of <br>· Easy<br>It becomes a game of the sound of C key.<br>Three of sound will be in order.</p><p>· Normal<br>Sharp, also flat sound.<br>Three of sound will be in order.</p><p>· Hard<br>Sharp, also flat sound.<br>Five of sound will be in order.</p><p>────────────────────<br>Other features<br>────────────────────<br>■ Index<br>I can see the past score of the game.</p><p>■ World Index<br>You can compare with other players score.</p><p>■
